description: The Department of Justice Canada has a requirement to purchase and deliver office chairs to various locations across Canada before March 31, 2024.

# National Chair Order for the Department of Justice (JUS)
### Procurement Notice

#### Reference Information
* Reference Number: cb-542-58508726
* Solicitation Number: 1000032912-RFP-JUS
* Amendment Number: 7
* Publication Date: 2023-12-22
* Closing Date for Tenders: 2024-01-18T14:00:00

#### Description of Requirements
The Department of Justice Canada invites eligible suppliers to participate in a Request for Proposal (RFP) for the purchase, delivery, and installation of office chairs to various locations across Canada. The scope of supply includes:

* Rotary chairs and Rotary stools
* Office seating for Toronto, Ottawa, Halifax, Vancouver, Montreal, Winnipeg, Saskatoon, Calgary, and Edmonton

#### Eligibility and Qualification
To be considered for this procurement, suppliers must:

* Be pre-qualified and have a valid Supply Arrangement (SA)
* Not be under a final judgment or a declared undischarged bankruptcy
* Be in compliance with the Government of Canada's requirements for goods and services procurements

#### Set-Aside
This procurement is set aside for Indigenous businesses and for small and minority businesses in accordance with Article 800 of the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).

#### Evaluation Criteria
The tender will be awarded based on the lowest price.

#### Contact Information
For inquiries regarding this procurement, please contact:

* Ryan Greig, Contracting Authority
* Email: Ryan.Greig@justice.gc.ca
* Phone: (416) 997-3148

#### Related Documents
The following documents are available on the Canada Buys website:

* Request for Proposal (RFP)
* Amendment 1
* Amendment 2
* Amendment 3
* Questions and Answers (Q&A)

Note:

* There is no security associated with the requirement.
* The procurement is subject to the rules and regulations of the Government of Canada's procurement policies.
* Canada reserves the right to withdraw or modify the tender at any time without incurring any liability.
